THE FIRST ANALOGUES OF LNA (LOCKED NUCLEIC ACIDS):
PHOSPHOROTHIOATE-LNA AND 2'-THIO-LNA

front.div:
Abstract: LNA (Locked Nucleic Acids, 1, X = O, Y = O) is a novel oligonucleotide analogue capable of
recognizing complementary DNA and RNA with unprecedented thermal affinities. Synthesis of the first chemicaily
modified LNA analogues is reported. A 9-mer phosphomthioate-LNA containing three LNA thymine monomers
(1, X = O, Y = S, Base = thymin-l-yl) and 9-mer LNAs containing one, three or five 2'-thio-LNA monomers (1,
X = S, Y = O, Base = uraeil-l-yl) were able to recognize both complementary DNA and RNA with thermal
affinities comparable to those of parent LNA..
